page.title: 07EDUCATION IN THE AREA (1)
page.content: The area is well served with one Comprehensive School,one Junior School,one Infant School,and one Infant and Junior School combined. {Brockworth Comprehensive School}was built 18 years ago and caters for 800 children with 45 teaching staff.The ages of pupil are from 11 to 18.There is a large sixth form which provides a variety of subject options.The catchment area extends to Cranham, Birdlip,Upton-St.Leonards,Shurdington, Hucclecote,and even to Gloucester. {Shurdington CofE County Primary School was built 23 years ago and caters for 110 children,4 full time and 2 part time staff.The age of pupils ranges from 4 to 11.The area served by the school includes Shurdington Village,Bentham Village and the housing as far as Culgrove lane north along the A46.
